New Records: De'Aaron Fox scored 29 points with 10 assists and 6 rebounds
Key Match Events: Kings used a strong fourth quarter to take control and seal the deal
19-4 run in the fourth that resulted in a 20-point lead
Keegan Murray made a huge block in the third
Kings hot shooting from three and pace kept them ahead
Pre-Game Insights: Coach's game plan was to have De'Aaron Fox drive more and touch the paint
Fox made a concerted effort to get to the mid-range and the hoop
Post-Match Reflections: De'Aaron Fox said the coaching staff basically told him to drive more and touch the paint
The team looked closer to the team from the last two years
DeMar DeRozan's lower back tightness was a concern
Miscellaneous Highlights: Eight players on the Kings hit threes
Bench scoring was led by Trey Lyles with 13 points
The Kings won the rebounding battle 45-40
The Suns Shooting was 37% overall and 30% from three
The Kings also outscored the Suns 68-48 in the second half
Others: The Kings will take on the Minnesota Timberwolves Friday at 7 p.m. at home
DeMar DeRozan's lower back tightness was a concern
The team was without Kevin Durant, Bradley Beal and Grayson Allen
